Dear Editor, Up to 09:40 February 17, 2020, there have been 70,640 confirmed SARS-CoV-2 (aka 2019-nCoV) cases in China. <mark class="stats">Sichuan Provincial People’s Hospital acts as an organ transplant center in west of China, approximately 200 solid organ transplants performed each year and can perform heart, lung, liver, kidney, small bowel, stem cell transplantation, so it is necessary to establish a hospitalspecific protocol to deal with the SARS-CoV-2 infection for the donor and recipient</mark>. The donation protocol of Sichuan Provincial People’s Hospital

summary: 1. Epidemiological screening of SARS-CoV-2 for potential donors and their families: (i) Ask in detail about the history of travel in Wuhan in the 14 days before the onset of the illness, or exposed to suspected respiratory infections.
During the maintenance of the donor in the ICU, the ward should not have SARS-CoV-2 infected patients, and the medical staff should not have related epidemiological contact history.
The coordinator should protect himself during the whole donation work, including surgical masks, hand hygiene, and avoid contact with suspected or confirmed SARS-CoV-2 pneumonia.

3. Epidemiological screening of the recipients and the families (i) Avoid the transplant surgery for recipients who were from SARS-CoV-2 affected areas during the epidemic.Ask about the travel history in the 14 days before the transplant surgery,include the families.
CT examination, members of 2019-nCoV Working Group should have the consultation to exclude the SARS-CoV-2 infection.
(i) Ask recipients to strengthen learning on how to strengthen the protection and avoid infection from SARS-CoV-2.
Always put on mask s during the epidemic situation, pay attention to hand hygiene, and cooperate with medical staff to perform SARS-CoV2-related surveillance daily.
5. Management measures for suspected SARS-CoV-2 infection after transplantation (i) Isolate the recipient and the family immediately and report to hospital administration.
Perform SARS-CoV-2 nucleic acid test, laboratory test, high-resolution CT examination immediately, and ask members of 2019-nCoV Working Group for consultations.

Author details 1 Department of Critical Care Medicine, Sichuan Academy of Medical Sciences and Sichuan Provincial People’s Hospital, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu 610072, Sichuan Province, China.
